revised_title: Seasonal Variations in Arthropod-Borne Disease Agents and Control Strategies
tldr: The article discusses the seasonal variations in the spread of arthropod-borne disease agents, such as viruses and protozoans, and their implications for control. It highlights how these diseases are transmitted through insects like mosquitoes and midges, and how their activity is influenced by temperature and moisture. The author also explains the importance of understanding the host-vector cycles and climatic zones to devise appropriate control measures, including vaccination, insect control, and environmental management.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Epidemiology and Disease Control
